bioghist.p: Harriet Ann Abbott Nelson (b. 1935) was Moderator of the 196th General Assembly of the Presbyterian Church (U.S.A.), 1984-1985. Nelson and her husband John were educators in Napa, California. Before being elected to this position, Mrs. Nelson was active at every governing body level in the church: she served a term as Moderator of the Presbytery of the Redwoods, was a member of the Program Agency Board and United Presbyterian Women Committees, and was church organist in Napa and Stockton. From 1963 to 1966 she and her husband served as missionaries in Cameroon, West Africa, working at the Hope School in Elat.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of Harriet Nelson's papers from her time as Moderator of the General Assembly. Materials include: incoming and outgoing correspondence with ministers, church members, and other leaders within the church; appointment and travel schedules; clippings and newsletters about Nelson's election as Moderator; several church bulletins, programs, and postcards; and a photograph of Nelson. The correspondence relates to Nelson's visits to churches and organizations as well as the statements and policies of the General Assembly on matters such as Apartheid, abortion, and homosexuality.
